speaker: Lucas
text: Hey, do you think we can hike up to Crystal Peak this Saturday?
ipa: heɪ | dʊ jə θɪŋk wi kən haɪk ʌp tə ˈkrɪstəl piːk ðɪs ˈsæɾɚdeɪ
stress: HEY | do YOU THINK we can HIKE UP to CRYSTAL PEAK this SATURDAY
linking:
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (linking 'do' to 'you')
"can hike" → /kən haɪk/ (linking 'can' to 'hike')
"up to" → /ʌp tə/ (linking 'up' to 'to')

speaker: Sophia
text: Maybe! But we should check the weather forecast first. It might rain all weekend.
ipa: ˈmeɪbi | bət wi ʃəd ʧɛk ðə ˈwɛðɚ ˈfɔrkæst fɚst | ɪt maɪt reɪn ɔl ˈwiːkɛnd
stress: MAYBE | but WE SHOULD CHECK the WEATHER FORECAST FIRST | it MIGHT RAIN all WEEKEND
linking:
"should check" → /ʃəd ʧɛk/ (linking 'should' to 'check')
"might rain" → /maɪt reɪn/ (linking 'might' to 'rain')

speaker: Lucas
text: True. If it pours, we could always pick an easier trail. Also, do you think Jake will be able to join us? He’s been super busy lately.
ipa: tru | ɪf ɪt pɔrz | wi kəd ˈɔlweɪz pɪk ən ˈiːziɚ treɪl | ˈɔlsoʊ | dʊ jə θɪŋk ʤeɪk wɪl bi ˈeɪbəl tə ʤɔɪn ʌs | hiz bɪn ˈsuːpɚ ˈbɪzi ˈleɪtli
stress: TRUE | if it POURS | we COULD ALWAYS PICK an EASIER TRAIL | ALSO | do YOU THINK JAKE will be ABLE to JOIN US | he's been SUPER BUSY LATELY
linking:
"could always" → /kəd ˈɔlweɪz/ (linking 'could' to 'always')
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (linking 'do' to 'you')
"will be" → /wɪl bi/ (linking 'will' to 'be')

speaker: Sophia
text: I asked him yesterday, and he said he might come if he finishes his project by Friday. Otherwise, he may have to work overtime.
ipa: aɪ æskt ɪm ˈjɛstɚdeɪ | ənd hi sɛd hi maɪt kʌm ɪf hi ˈfɪnɪʃɪz hɪz ˈprɑʤɛkt baɪ ˈfraɪdeɪ | ˈʌðɚwaɪz | hi meɪ hæv tə wɜrk ˈoʊvɚtaɪm
stress: I ASKED HIM YESTERDAY | and HE SAID he MIGHT COME if he FINISHES his PROJECT by FRIDAY | OTHERWISE | he MAY HAVE to WORK OVERTIME
linking:
"asked him" → /æskt ɪm/ (linking 'asked' to 'him')
"have to" → /hæv tə/ (linking 'have' to 'to')

speaker: Lucas
text: Got it. We could also invite Mia and Tom. They're usually up for spontaneous trips.
ipa: ɡɑt ɪt | wi kəd ˈɔlsoʊ ɪnˈvaɪt ˈmiə ənd tɑm | ðɛr ˈjuʒəwəli ʌp fɔr spɑnˈteɪniəs trɪps
stress: GOT IT | we COULD ALSO INVITE MIA and TOM | they're USUALLY UP for SPONTANEOUS TRIPS
linking:
"could also" → /kəd ˈɔlsoʊ/ (linking 'could' to 'also')
"invite Mia" → /ɪnˈvaɪt ˈmiə/ (linking 'invite' to 'Mia')

speaker: Sophia
text: Good idea! Even if Jake can't make it, we won't have to cancel everything. Plus, Tom can drive if we need an extra car.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdiə | ˈivən ɪf ʤeɪk kænt meɪk ɪt | wi woʊnt hæv tə ˈkænsəl ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ | plʌs | tɑm kən draɪv ɪf wi nid ən ˈɛkstrə kɑr
stress: GOOD IDEA | EVEN if JAKE CAN'T MAKE IT | we WON'T HAVE to CANCEL EVERYTHING | PLUS | TOM can DRIVE if we NEED an EXTRA CAR
linking:
"can't make" → /kænt meɪk/ (linking 'can't' to 'make')
"have to" → /hæv tə/ (linking 'have' to 'to')

speaker: Lucas
text: Awesome. We could bring some snacks too — you know, just in case we get stuck somewhere and can't find food.
ipa: ˈɔsəm | wi kəd brɪŋ səm snæks tu — ju noʊ | ʤʌst ɪn keɪs wi ɡɛt stʌk ˈsʌmˌwɛr ənd kænt faɪnd fuːd
stress: AWESOME | we COULD BRING some SNACKS TOO — you KNOW | JUST IN CASE we GET STUCK SOMEWHERE and CAN'T FIND FOOD
linking:
"could bring" → /kəd brɪŋ/ (linking 'could' to 'bring')
"just in" → /ʤʌst ɪn/ (linking 'just' to 'in')

speaker: Sophia
text: Haha, classic you. Always thinking ahead. Alright, let’s make sure we can finalize the plan by Thursday!
ipa: hɑ hɑ | ˈklæsɪk ju | ˈɔlweɪz ˈθɪŋkɪŋ əˈhɛd | ɔlˈraɪt | lɛts meɪk ʃʊr wi kən ˈfaɪnəˌlaɪz ðə plæn baɪ ˈθɜrzdeɪ
stress: HAHA | CLASSIC YOU | ALWAYS THINKING AHEAD | ALRIGHT | LET'S MAKE SURE we can FINALIZE the PLAN by THURSDAY
linking:
"thinking ahead" → /ˈθɪŋkɪŋ əˈhɛd/ (linking 'thinking' to 'ahead')
"make sure" → /meɪk ʃʊr/ (linking 'make' to 'sure')
